OtherText.val: Cancer Care Ontario
version 0.7

Question.title: The axial CT lung reconstruction series:

OtherText.val: The 10 most dominant nodules (≥ 4 mm) need to be measured.

ListItem.title: Interval increase in ground glass component

DisplayedItem.title: If there are additional nodules, please repeat Nodule Section for nodules 2 -10

Question.title: Number of lung nodules present in total:
Check the relevant lung findings and describe as needed:
*If abnormal, answer the applicable questions below:
*If abnormal, answer the applicable questions below:
*If yes, answer the applicable questions below :

OtherText.val: The most worrisome nodule described above is assigned a Lung-RADS category

ListItem.title: 0 - Additional lung cancer screening CT images and/or comparison to prior chest CT examinations is needed

OtherText.val: Additional lung cancer screening CT images and/or comparison to prior chest CT examinations is needed

ListItem.title: 1 - Continue annual screening with LDCT in 12 months

OtherText.val: No nodules and definitely benign nodules
Continue annual screening with LDCT in 12 months

ListItem.title: 2 - Continue annual screening with LDCT in 12 months

OtherText.val: Benign Appearance or Behavior
Nodules with a very low 90% likelihood of becoming a clinically active cancer due to size or lack of growth
Continue annual screening with LDCT in 12 months
Probably Benign
Probably benign finding(s) ‐ short term follow up suggested; includes nodules with alow likelihood of becoming a clinically active cancer
6 month LDCT

ListItem.title: 4A - LDCT in 3 months; PET/CT may be used when there is a ≥ 8 mm solid component

OtherText.val: Findings for which additional diagnostic testing and/or tissue sampling is recommended
3 month LDCT; PET/CT may be used when there is a ≥ 8 mm solid component

ListItem.title: 4B - chest CT with or without contrast, PET/CT and/or tissue sampling depending on the *probability of malignancy and comorbidities. PET/CT may be used when there is a ≥ 8 mm solid component

OtherText.val: Findings for which additional diagnostic testing and/or tissue sampling is recommended
chest CT with or without contrast, PET/CT and/or tissue sampling depending on the *probability of malignancy and comorbidities. PET/CT may be used when there is a ≥ 8 mm solid component.

ListItem.title: 4X - chest CT with or without contrast, PET/CT and/or tissue sampling depending on the *probability of malignancy and comorbidities. PET/CT may be used when there is a ≥ 8 mm solid component

OtherText.val: Findings for which additional diagnostic testing and/or tissue sampling is recommended
chest CT with or without contrast, PET/CT and/or tissue sampling depending on the *probability of malignancy and comorbidities. PET/CT may be used when there is a ≥ 8 mm solid component.
